author: Isreal Mathew
comment: The wear graph is great. I was able to use it to prove to a watch face/app designer that their app caused battery drain. Now that I have two android wear watches though I need to request that multi-watch support would be appreciated. Many thanks.

author: Andrew Rowbottom
comment: It's not perfect, I had to install it twice before it showed up in my launcher. But now I can monitor BOTH phone and watch batteries easily. I've not tried the CSV export yet, so I can't comment.
title: Wear battery graph sold it to me

author: Erick N
comment: I wanted a widget capable of displaying battery info from my watch. This does the job quite well.
title: Perfect for Android wear

author: Tor Helgesen
comment: I have used this for a while. It is OK, but it show 1000 times less current. Normally it show -0.1 to -0.5 mA. It should be A.

author: Parth Majmudar
comment: Needed a widget to quickly check my Wear battery level while I'm not wearing it around the house. This fits the bill perfectly.

author: Conrad Feder
comment: The best out there. Any possible way to set it up so that when you tap on the widget it launches an app?
title: Great app

author: Paul Franek
comment: Does its job, but spontaneously stops working every so often, actually requiring an uninstall to fix!  Very annoying.

author: Dan Mornis
comment: Shows watch and phone level on one widget.
title: Very good

author: Thomas Thorne
comment: Pleased that it works with my S4 and seems to read the better level from my LG G Watch too. Widget shows a reasonably clear graph. Sadly the export .csv function seems to be broken as I only get empty files generated.

reply.author: Codeka
reply.content: Hi Thomas, are you able to send me a bug report? Do an export, then go to Settings > Developer Options > Take a bug report and email me (dean@codeka.com.au) I can see what's going wrong. FWIW, exports work for me on my Nexus 5 :)

title: As a widget it works. Export fails though

author: Tabris Chen
comment: Helpful to let you monitor your battery level
title: Really useful app

author: Brian Davis
comment: no change to home screen, no app listed in standard app browsing, no option to open from google play screen. Uninstalled.
title: Unable to open on Samsung Galaxy S5

author: Jacob Berry
comment: App not showing in app drawer or in my widgets list.
